oracle.iam.identity.icf.connector.openfire.provider

Class PropertyProvider.User

  • java.lang.Object
    • oracle.iam.identity.icf.foundation.logging.AbstractLoggable
      • oracle.iam.identity.icf.connector.openfire.Provider<Entity.Property>
        • oracle.iam.identity.icf.connector.openfire.provider.PropertyProvider
          • oracle.iam.identity.icf.connector.openfire.provider.PropertyProvider.User
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    oracle.iam.identity.icf.foundation.logging.Loggable
    Enclosing class:
    PropertyProvider

    public static class PropertyProvider.User
extends PropertyProvider
    Default implementation of the PropertyProvider interface for Users, which reads and writes data from the ofUserProp database table.
    This implementation will not explicitly verify if a user exists, when operating on its properties.
    The methods of this implementation will not throw an exception if the user does not exists.
    Warning:
    In virtually all cases a user property provider should not be used directly. Instead, use the Entity.Property returned by User#property() to create, read, update or delete user properties.
    Failure to do so is likely to result in inconsistent data behavior and race conditions. Direct access to the user property provider is only provided for special-case logic.
